Title: China's refined petroleum supply to N. Korea rises slightly last ...
Description: China's supply of refined petroleum to North Korea slightly increased in the January-November period of last year from the previous year, according to the United Nations' website Friday.

Title: Putin suggests US ceasefire idea for Ukraine needs serious rework...
Description: President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday that Russia supported a U.S. proposal for a ceasefire in Ukraine in principle, but that any truce would have to address the root causes of the conflict and many crucial details needed to be sorted out.

Title: Trump voices desire to reestablish ties with Kim Jong-un, says Ki...
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday expressed his desire to reestablish the relationship that he had with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un during his first term, boasting that he 'got along great' with the reclusive leader and still has a 'great' relationship with him.

Title: Trump threatens tariffs on European wine and spirits in escalatin...
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday threatened to slap a 200 percent tariff on wine, cognac and other alcohol imports from Europe, opening a new front in a global trade war that has roiled financial markets and raised recession fears.

Title: Trump says he won't 'bend' on tariffs
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said Thursday that he won't 'bend' on tariffs on steel, aluminum or cars, as claims of policy inconsistency lingered due to his administration's recent adjustments to the imposition of levies on Canadian and Mexican goods.

Title: US negotiators to set out Ukraine truce plan to Russia
Description: U.S. negotiators travelled to Russia on Thursday to present their plan for a 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine, but Moscow warned in advance it would refuse any temporary deal that gave Kyiv a 'breather.'

Title: Trump threatens 200% wine tariff if EU does not remove whiskey ta...
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that he would put a 200% wine tariff on all wines and other alcoholic products coming out of the European Union if the bloc did not remove its tariff on whiskey.

Title: At least 25 bodies retrieved from Pakistan train siege
Description: The bodies of at least 25 people, including 21 hostages, killed in a train siege by separatist gunmen in Pakistan were retrieved from the site on Thursday ahead of the first funerals, officials said.

Title: NK, Chinese vessels' collision prompts suspicions of sanctions vi...
Description: North Korea and China have remained silent so far regarding a collision between two of their vessels in the West Sea, likely because they were engaged in the illegal transfer of North Korean coal, which is prohibited under U.N. Security Council (UNSC) sanctions, experts said Thursday.

Title: ICC takes custody of ex-Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte in c...
Description: The International Criminal Court(ICC) took custody of former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte on Wednesday on a warrant accusing him of crimes against humanity for deadly anti-drugs crackdowns he oversaw while in office.

Title: China develops new high-protein corn to replace foreign soybeans
Description: Chinese agricultural scientists are developing new strains of protein-rich corn that can serve as a substitute for soybeans in animal feed, a potential game-changer for China's drive to reduce its reliance on overseas grain.

Title: Intel appoints chip industry veteran Lip-Bu Tan as CEO
Description: Intel on Wednesday named former board member and chip industry veteran Lip-Bu Tan as its CEO and signaled the struggling but storied chipmaker was unlikely to split up its chip-design and manufacturing operations.

Title: Trump threatens further tariffs as EU, Canada retaliate for those...
Description: Donald Trump threatened on Wednesday to escalate a global trade war with further tariffs on European Union goods, as major U.S. trading partners said they would retaliate for trade barriers already erected by the U.S. president.

Title: US consumer inflation slows in February; tariffs expected to boos...
Description: U.S. consumer prices increased moderately in February as higher shelter costs were partially offset by cheaper airline fares, giving the Federal Reserve room to keep interest rates unchanged next week while monitoring the economic impact of a trade war.

Title: Wall Street rises after encouraging inflation data, but trade war...
Description: U.S. stock indexes rose Wednesday after Wall Street got some relief from an encouraging inflation update. But even on a rare up day for the market, President Donald Trump’s trade war still knocked stocks around.

Title: N. Korean cargo ship suspected of smuggling coal collided with Ch...
Description: A North Korean cargo ship suspected of smuggling out North Korean coal collided with a Chinese ship and sank in the Yellow Sea last month, according to a source familiar with the matter Thursday.

Title: Pressed to accept ceasefire in Ukraine, Putin seems likely to see...
Description: By signaling its openness to a ceasefire, Ukraine has handed the Kremlin a difficult challenge at a time when the Russian military has the upper hand in the war: Should Moscow accept a truce and abandon hopes of making new gains, or should it reject the offer and risk derailing a cautious rapprochement with Washington ?

Title: Canada will announce more than $20 billion in tariffs in response...
Description: TORONTO - Canada will announce Canadian $29.8 billion ($20.7 billion) in retaliatory tariffs in response to the 25% steel and aluminum tariffs that U.S. President Donald Trump has leveled, a senior Canadian government official said Wednesday.

Title: Rubio says not going to discuss how to 'take over Canada' at G7
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said he would not raise Canada's sovereignty when he visits Quebec later Wednesday for Group of Seven talks, despite taunts by President Donald Trump.

Title: US hardens registration rules for Canadians visiting for more tha...
Description: WASHINGTON - The United States will require Canadians visiting for more than 30 days to register with authorities and have their fingerprints taken, the federal register showed Wednesday, as trade tensions soar between the North American neighbors.

Title: Kremlin says waiting for US to inform it about Ukraine ceasefire
Description: The Kremlin said Wednesday it was waiting for the US to inform it about the details of a proposed ceasefire in Ukraine that Kyiv agreed to after talks in Saudi Arabia.

Title: TSMC pitched Intel foundry JV to Nvidia, AMD, Broadcom: sources
Description: TSMC has pitched U.S. chip designers Nvidia, Advanced Micro Devices and Broadcom about taking stakes in a joint venture that would operate Intel's factories, according to four sources familiar with the matter.

Title: Macron urges allies to plan 'credible security guarantees' for Uk...
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday called on military chiefs from across Europe and beyond to draw up a plan 'to define credible security guarantees' for Ukraine in the event of a ceasefire, the presidency said.

Title: Musk launches appeal to restore $56 bil. Tesla payday

Title: BRICS nations divide on US dollar replacement, with India declari...

Title: Pakistan insurgents take dozens of hostages in attack on train, p...
Description: Separatist militants blew up a railway track and opened fire on a passenger train in southwestern Pakistan on Tuesday, taking dozens of hostages and battling security forces conducting a rescue operation, police and the insurgents said.

Title: Trump selects new Tesla on White House driveway to show support f...
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump shopped for a new Tesla on the White House driveway on Tuesday, selecting a shiny red sedan to show his support for Elon Musk 's electric vehicle company as it faces blowback because of his work to advance the president's political agenda and downsize the federal government.

Title: US to resume security support to Ukraine as Kyiv says it is ready...

Title: 50% tariff on Canadian steel, aluminum won't be imposed this week...

Title: Marco Rubio: Ukraine's 'only way' to end war is through concessio...

Title: Greenland votes under shadow of Trump
Description: Greenland began voting Tuesday in legislative elections which could yield a timeline for independence for the Danish self-governing territory coveted by U.S. President Donald Trump.

Title: Duterte arrested in the Philippines on an ICC warrant over drug k...

Title: US judge says Musk's DOGE must release records on operations run ...
Description: A federal judge on Monday ordered the government-downsizing team created by U.S. President Donald Trump and spearheaded by billionaire Elon Musk to make public records concerning its operations, which he said had been run in 'unusual secrecy.'

Title: Germany not to reopen embassy in N. Korea while Ukraine war conti...
Description: Germany has no plans to reopen its embassy in North Korea while the Russia-Ukraine war continues, a German government official said Tuesday, citing the country's involvement in the conflict.

Title: US, Ukraine to meet in Saudi Arabia after disastrous White House ...
Description: U.S. and Ukrainian officials were to meet in Saudi Arabia on Tuesday for talks aimed at mending ties and gauging if Ukraine is willing to make concessions under President Donald Trump's push to end Russia's war with Ukraine swiftly.

Title: Rights groups urge Zelenskyy to send N. Korean POWs to South Kore...
Description: Human rights activists in South Korea and overseas on Tuesday urged Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to send North Korean prisoners of war (POW) to the South, saying it would not only be the right thing to do but would also help Ukraine’s war efforts against Russia.

Title: Tesla tumbles again as investors bail on Elon Musk's suddenly str...
Description: Shares of Tesla slid again Monday as confidence in Elon Musk's electric car company continues to disintegrate following a post-election 'Trump bump.'

Title: Foxconn launches traditional Chinese large language model for AI-...
Description: Foxconn Technology Group, the world's largest electronics contract manufacturer and major iPhone supplier for Apple, launched its first Chinese large language model (LLM) trained on traditional characters, as the Taiwanese company pushes forward the use of artificial intelligence (AI) in factories.

Title: Trump may meet Xi in China as soon as April despite escalating tr...
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump could visit China as early as next month, according to multiple diplomatic sources, as the American leader has appeared focused on hammering out a deal with Beijing since his return to the White House.

Title: Syria's interim president signs deal with Kurdish-led SDF to merg...

Title: Tanker hired by US military ablaze off UK after hit by container ...

Title: AI-related posts offer up to nearly $7,000 per month for college ...

Title: N. Korea ramps up criticism against S. Korea-US drills, but no me...

Title: Ontario slaps 25% tax increase on electricity exports to US in re...

Title: White House reaffirms commitment to 'complete' denuclearization o...

Title: S. Korean man shot fatally in robbery incident in Philippines
Description: A South Korean man has been shot and killed by robbers in the Philippines' capital of Manila, according to a local media outlet and the Korean embassy in the country Monday.

Title: Rescue operation launched after collision between an oil tanker a...
Description: An oil tanker and a cargo ship collided off the coast of eastern England Monday and a major rescue operation is underway, Britain’s coast guard said.

Title: Syria announces end of a military operation against Assad-linked ...
Description: Syria's interim government on Monday announced the end of a days-long military operation against insurgents loyal to ousted president Bashar Assad and his family in the worst fighting since the end of the 13-year civil war in December.

Title: Rubio says US canceling 83 percent of USAID programs

Title: Zelensky, ahead of US talks, says Ukraine wants peace

Title: North Korea's nuclear-powered submarine may have relied on Russia...

Description: U.S. officials are planning to use Tuesday's meeting with a Ukrainian delegation in Saudi Arabia in part to determine whether Ukraine is willing to make material concessions to Russia to end the war, according to two U.S. officials.

Title: Europe's dependence on US arms rose in last 5 years: report
Description: NATO countries in Europe more than doubled their arms imports in the past five years, more than 60 percent of which were purchases of U.S. weaponry, researchers on Monday.

Title: N. Korea fires multiple ballistic missiles as S. Korea, US start ...
Description: North Korea fired multiple ballistic missiles toward the West Sea on Monday, South Korea's military said, as Seoul and Washington launched their annual military drills.

Title: China wants to change world with disruptive technologies, but wha...
Description: China's advancements in disruptive technologies are rapidly blurring the lines between science fiction and reality, from humanoid robots and a computer in the brain to encryption-shattering quantum computers and hypersonic aircraft.

Title: Syria's Sharaa scrambles to contain deadliest violence in years
Description: Syria's leader vowed on Sunday to hunt down the perpetrators of violent clashes pitting loyalists of deposed President Bashar al-Assad against the country's new Islamist rulers and said he would hold to account anyone who overstepped their authority.

Title: Trump declines to rule out 2025 US recession
Description: President Donald Trump declined Sunday to rule out the possibility that the United States might enter a recession this year.

Title: Israel cuts off electricity supply to Gaza, affecting a desalinat...
Description: Israel cut off the electricity supply to Gaza , officials said Sunday, affecting a desalination plant producing drinking water for part of the arid territory. Hamas called it part of Israel's 'starvation policy.'

Title: Mark Carney wins race to replace Trudeau as Canada's prime minist...
Description: Former central banker Mark Carney won the race to become leader of Canada's ruling Liberal Party and will succeed Justin Trudeau as prime minister, official results showed on Sunday.

Title: Who is Mark Carney, next prime minister of Canada?
Description: Former central banker Mark Carney will become Canada’s next prime minister after a Liberal Party leadership vote in a landslide.

Title: N. Korea urges Japan to apologize to Korean victims of 1945 Tokyo...

Title: Syria president calls for unity after reports of mass killings

Title: China-US trade war heats up with Beijing's tariffs to take effect

Title: Protesters rally on International Women's Day, fearing far right

Title: Pope thanks volunteers for 'miracle of tenderness' as another Hol...
Description: Pope Francis issued a message Sunday thanking volunteers for the 'miracle of tenderness' they offer the sick, as he continued his recovery from double pneumonia and doctors reported some positive news. After more than three weeks in the hospital, the 88-year-old pope is responding well to treatment and has shown a 'gradual, slight improvement' in recent days.

Title: China consumption slump deepens as February prices drop
Description: Consumer prices in China fell last month for the first time in a year, with authorities in the world's second-largest economy struggling to kickstart spending and trade headwinds intensifying as U.S. tariffs kick in under Donald Trump.

Title: China's top court puts AI protections on its 2025 agenda

Title: N. Korea unveils nuclear-powered submarine for the 1st time
Description: North Korea unveiled for the first time a nuclear-powered submarine under construction, a weapons system that can pose a major security threat to South Korea and the U.S.

Title: Gene Hackman died at home week after wife Betsy Arakawa died from...
Description: Forensic experts came to a heartrending conclusion Friday about the manner of death for actor Gene Hackman: he died of heart disease with complications from Alzheimer's disease on an empty stomach a week after a rare, rodent-borne disease took the life of his wife at their home in Santa Fe.

Title: Trump wrote to Iran's leader about that country's nuclear program...
Description: President Donald Trump sent a letter to Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei, seeking a new deal with Tehran to restrain its rapidly advancing nuclear program and replace the agreement he withdrew America from during his first term in office.

Title: N. Korea leader visits shipyards to inspect nuclear submarine pro...
Description: North Korea's leader Kim Jong-un emphazised the importance of strengthening naval power as he visited major shipyards to inspect construction projects of naval vessels and nuclear submarines, state media KCNA reported on Saturday.

Title: Trump mentions Taiwan, Korea while saying America lost chip busin...
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump mentioned Taiwan and Korea Friday, as he argued that the United States lost semiconductor business to foreign countries.

Title: Taiwan fears Beijing is taking independence crackdown overseas

Title: S. Korea rebukes Russia for supporting N. Korea's military buildu...

Title: Why should America worry about Trump? Try the price of eggs, say ...
Description: As their party struggles to navigate the early days of Donald Trump's second presidency, some Democrats are convinced that their road to recovery lies in the price of eggs.

Title: US-Japan alliance unequal, Trump complains
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said Japan is not required to protect the United States militarily and makes 'a fortune' from it economically, as he fired off an impromptu broadside at a key ally.

Title: Chinese credit ratings firm downgrades Thailand over crime scanda...
Description: A Chinese ratings firm has downgraded Thailand's creditworthiness due to a series of damaging crime scandals denting the country's appeal to tourists and the threat of U.S. tariffs.

Title: N. Korean POW says used anti-drone jamming guns in battle against...

Title: EU leaders commit to working together after Trump signals that Eu...

Title: N. Korea promotes women's loyalty ahead of Int'l Women's Day

Title: If NATO members don't pay, US won't defend them: Trump

Title: Trump signs order to establish strategic bitcoin reserve

Title: N. Korea warns S. Korea, US will pay 'horrible price' over next w...

Title: Trump delays tariffs on USMCA-compliant goods from Mexico, Canada...

Title: Taiwan says TSMC investment 'historic moment' for US ties

Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's administration is planning to revoke temporary legal status for some 240,000 Ukrainians who fled the conflict with Russia, a senior Trump official and three sources familiar with the matter said, potentially putting them on a fast-track to deportation.

Title: China slams US tariffs, says its economy is resilient but there a...

Title: EU leaders to hold emergency Ukraine talks, seeking to adapt to n...
Description: European Union leaders plan to hold emergency talks on Thursday to agree ways to quickly increase their military budgets after the Trump administration signaled that Europe must take care of its own security and also suspended assistance to Ukraine.

Title: Open-source models and fresh funding: China's AI start-ups scramb...

Title: Divided US Supreme Court rejects Trump bid to freeze nearly $2 bi...
Description: A sharply divided Supreme Court in the United States on Wednesday rejected the Trump administration's bid to freeze nearly $2 billion in foreign aid , but it was not clear how quickly money might start flowing.

Title: Trudeau not willing to lift Canada's retaliatory tariffs if Trump...

Title: Macron says he'll confer with allies on protecting Europe with Fr...
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said Wednesday he will discuss with European allies the possibility of using France's nuclear deterrent to protect the continent from Russian threats, amid concerns over potential U.S. disengagement.

Title: Ukraine plans new talks with US after intelligence sharing ends

Title: US plans to fire 80,000 Veterans Affairs workers as part of Trump...
Description: The Department of Veterans Affairs is planning to cut more than 80,000 workers from the agency, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters, drawing condemnation from military veteran groups and Democrats.

Title: Trump warns Hamas as US holds unprecedented talks for Gaza hostag...
Description: The United States broke a longstanding diplomatic taboo by holding secret talks with Hamas on securing the release of U.S. hostages held in Gaza, sources told Reuters on Wednesday, while President Donald Trump warned of 'hell to pay' should the Palestinian militant group not comply.

Title: N. Korea abruptly suspends resumed foreign tours to Rason

Title: Pope Francis off ventilation again after restful night, Vatican s...
Description: Pope Francis, who has been struggling to overcome double pneumonia for almost three weeks, was taken off mechanical ventilation on Wednesday after using it through the night to help with his breathing, the Vatican said.

Title: China's goals for 2025: five things to know
Description: China laid out its economic growth goals and spending for 2025 on Wednesday. Here are five key takeaways:Economic boost

Title: Seoul's spy agency detects sign of N. Korean troops in Russia lea...
Description: South Korea's spy agency said Wednesday that there is a sign that North Korean troops deployed to Russia for the war with Ukraine have been learning drone operations and tactics from Moscow.

Title: N. Korea appears close to completing 1st airborne early warning a...
Description: North Korea appears to be close to completing its first airborne early warning (AEW) aircraft in a 'significant' upgrade for the country's air force, a U.S. website monitoring North Korea said Wednesday.

Description: Chinese internet users flooded the social media account of the U.S. embassy in Beijing on Tuesday to mock President Donald Trump and the U.S. government, after it posted about Trump's fiery meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

Title: Generally favorable' crop yields in N. Korea last year despite f...
Description: North Korea's crop yields and production were 'generally favorable' last year despite torrential rains that flooded parts of the country, a report by the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) showed Wednesday.

Title: S. Korea's humanitarian aid to North comes to zero last year

Title: UN says children as young as 1 raped in Sudan
Description: Children as young as 1 have been raped by armed men during the conflict in Sudan, the U.N. said on Tuesday, condemning it as a horror that should 'shock anyone to their core.'

Title: Russia seeks deeper ties with Myanmar in trade and nuclear energy

Title: Arab leaders gather to endorse counterproposal to Trump's Gaza pl...

Title: China eyes US farm exports for retaliation, report says, as impor...
Description: Chinese manufacturers reported an uptick in orders in February as importers rushed to beat higher U.S. tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump, as a Chinese state media report said that Beijing was considering ways to retaliate.

Title: Pope gets visit from Vatican secretary of state, says he's sharin...

Title: US, Ukraine agree to terms of critical minerals deal

Description: Pope Francis has been in hospital with double pneumonia for 14 days — the longest hospitalization in his papacy. The Vatican says his condition is slightly improving, but doctors say his prognosis 'remains reserved.'

Description: U.S. and Russian officials met in Istanbul on Thursday for talks on resolving embassy issues as the two countries aimed to restore ties, Russian news agencies reported.
